thread.title: NASCAR at Daytona weather: Can-Am Duels face threat of rain delay | NASCAR | Sporting News
thread.title_full: NASCAR at Daytona weather: Can-Am Duels face threat of rain delay | NASCAR | Sporting News

author: Zac Al-Khateeb
title: NASCAR at Daytona weather: Can-Am Duels face threat of rain delay | NASCAR | Sporting News
text:
February 21, 2017 10:06pm EST February 21, 2017 9:56pm EST The weather seems to have it out for Daytona races. Daytona International Speedway (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:06 p.m. ET 
Updated at 10:06 p.m. ET 
One NASCAR event this month has already been delayed because of bad weather at Daytona International Speedway. It appears a second may be affected. 
The Can-Am Duels, which determine the order of the Daytona 500 field, face a threat of rain Thursday. The two-race event is scheduled to start at 7 p.m. ET, but The Weather Channel reports an 80 percent chance of rain, beginning early in the day and continuing into the afternoon in Daytona Beach, Fla. There is also a possibility of thunderstorms. 
MORE: Daytona: Passion to race fuels Earnhardt's return 
Though the rain is forecast to stop before the 7 p.m. start time, the Duels could be delayed as the track dries. 
The Clash at Daytona, a non-points race and the unofficial start to the NASCAR season, was postponed from Saturday night to Sunday morning because of rain. 
Chase Elliott and Dale Earnhardt Jr. will start at the front of their 21-car fields for the Duel races at 7 p.m. and 9 p.m., respectively. Elliott and Earnhardt earned those spots during qualifying for the Daytona 500 on Sunday. Below are the starting lineups for both Duels (asterisks denotes "open" drivers who need to race their way into the Daytona 500 during the Duels).
